poem:
**Dividends**

The sea shimmers with promise—
not of sunlight dancing on waves,
but of pockets swelling,
as oil on oceans' floor
sediments into gold.
Shells whisper secrets 
of ancient decibels,
while shareholders 
dream of overflowing coffers,
never hearing the whispers
of submerged wrecks
beneath the surface 
of their prosperity.
